title: Marine Le Pen's political future is at stake as her appeal trial opens
subhead: The far-right leader, convicted of embezzling public funds, is approaching a pivotal moment: The judges' decision will determine whether she can participate in the 2027 presidential election.

title: Iranian regime rallies supporters in bid to quell unrest
With US eyeing Greenland, NATO faces one of its most crucial tests
Corsican nationalist's assassination spotlights criminials' grip on island
subhead: Alain Orsoni, a former leader of the Movement for Self-Determination on the French island of Corsica, had spent time in exile in Nicaragua. Local police said his shooting death at his mother's funeral resembled those targeting associates of his son, a figure of the island's criminal underworld.

title: Paris launches project for Montparnasse renovation
subhead: The architect Renzo Piano unveiled his new renovation plan for the shopping center. Construction is hoped to start in 2028.

title: Being gay in Uganda, where the death penalty looms
subhead: Since Uganda's Parliament introduced the death penalty for 'aggravated homosexuality' in 2023, young homosexual people have been forced underground, with only brief moments of freedom, such as the Nyege Nyege electronic music festival.

title: 'What is happening with tariffs sums up Trumpism: Bombastic declarations, laborious implementation and unpredictable results'
subhead: Nine months after the announcement of tariffs on American imports, the 'golden age' promised by the US president largely remains a mirage. Far from being a driver of growth, the tariffs have acted more as a break on the economy, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

Venezuela's Delcy Rodriguez faces an obstacle-strewn path
subhead: The interim president, appointed after the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, must preserve the unity of Chavism while ensuring that she does not incur the wrath of Donald Trump.

title: Trump's brute force will not drive China out of Latin America
subhead: Trade has become the main vehicle of Chinese power, and the deep dependencies already created weigh more heavily than the threat of diplomatic, or even military, pressure wielded by the US.

title: Morgue near Tehran overwhelmed by bodies amid protest crackdown
subhead: Videos, uploaded to social media despite the internet shutdown in Iran, show a vast number of corpses piled up in the forensic center's warehouse and lined up in the yard. Witnesses corroborated the footage to Le Monde.
